member.name: T:System.IO.Pipes.PipeDirection
member.summary: Specifies the direction of the pipe.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeDirection.In
member.summary: Specifies that the pipe direction is in.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeDirection.InOut
member.summary: Specifies that the pipe direction is two-way.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeDirection.Out
member.summary: Specifies that the pipe direction is out.

member.name: T:System.IO.Pipes.PipeOptions
member.summary: Provides options for creating a object. This enumeration has a attribute that allows a bitwise combination of its member values.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeOptions.Asynchronous
member.summary: Indicates that the pipe can be used for asynchronous reading and writing.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeOptions.CurrentUserOnly
member.summary: When used to create a instance, indicates that the pipe can only be connected to a client created by the same user. When used to create a instance, indicates that the pipe can only connect to a server created by the same user. On Windows, it verifies both the user account and elevation level.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeOptions.None
member.summary: Indicates that there are no additional parameters.

member.name: F:System.IO.Pipes.PipeOptions.WriteThrough
member.summary: Indicates that the system should write through any intermediate cache and go directly to the pipe.
